snippet: In Europe and the West, Islamic State operatives have been instructed to kill at random, but more care is seemingly taken in planning attacks in majority Sunni Muslim nations like Bangladesh....
abstract: Intelligence experts propose Islamic State terrorists are modifying attacks in Islamic countries in order to avoid killing Muslims after bombing in Turkey prompted stinging rebuke by Al Qaeda.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Liam Stack from New York; Julfikar Ali Manik and Maher Sattar from Dhaka, Bangladesh; and Rami Nazzal from Ramallah, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: In Europe and the West, Islamic State operatives have been instructed to kill at random, but more care is seemingly taken in planning attacks in majority Sunni Muslim nations like Bangladesh.

headline.main: ISIS Seems to Tailor Attacks for Different Audiences
headline.print_headline: Appealing to Its Base, ISIS Tempers Its Violence in Muslim Countries

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
